What is the level of the patient's disability? This is the 30-day modified Rankin Scale score

display.value: Some symptoms but able to carry out all usual duties and activities
Some disability, unable to carry out all previous activities, but able to look after own affairs without assistance
Moderate disability; requiring some help, but able to walk without assistance
Moderately severe disability; unable to walk without assistance and unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance
Severe disability; bedridden, incontinent, and requiring constant nursing care and attention

text.value: Was patient a smoker at time of stroke?
If patient was a smoker before stroke, have they smoked tobacco since discharge?

Was the patient provided tobacco cessation counseling and referred to a cessation program?

Were any ED visits for TIA or stroke?

display.value: Discharged to SNF or other institutional long term care

If yes, most recent systolic blood pressure

Is this blood pressure usual for you?

Was your fall reported to a healthcare provider?
